tools

Class SettingsHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • tools.SettingsHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class SettingsHandler
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    SettingsHandler class is the main object to store all settings from UnDupeKeeper for save and restore settings data in just only one place.
    Author:
    vliopard
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Constructors

      SettingsHandler()

    • Constructor Detail

      • SettingsHandler

        public SettingsHandler()
        SettingsHandler Constructor - It starts a new fresh and clean Settings Object with default values.

      • SettingsHandler

        public SettingsHandler(java.lang.String directory,
               int idiomIndex,
               int lookNfeel,
               int encryptionAlgorithm,
               int xScreenPosition,
               int yScreenPosition)
        SettingsHandler Constructor - It starts a new Settings Object starting with the passed values as parameters.
        Parameters:
        directory - A String value that points to the current working directory.
        lookNfeel - An int value that informs the current look and feel of the system.
        encryptionAlgorithm - An int value that informs the current encryption algorithm of the system.
        xScreenPosition - An int value that informs the horizontal position of the settings dialog.
        yScreenPosition - An int value that informs the vertical position of the settings dialog.

    • Method Detail

      • setXY

        public void setXY(int xScreenPosition,
         int yScreenPosition)
        This method sets the position of the settings dialog screen.
        Parameters:
        xScreenPosition - An int value that informs the horizontal position of the settings dialog.
        yScreenPosition - An int value that informs the vertical position of the settings dialog.

      • setDirectory

        public void setDirectory(java.lang.String directory)
        This method sets the working directory of UnDupeKeeper.
        Parameters:
        directory - A String value that represents the path to an observed directory to keep unduplicated.

      • setLookAndFeel

        public void setLookAndFeel(int lookNfeel)
        This method sets the look and feel for the GUIs.
        Parameters:
        lookNfeel - An int value obtained from Settings.LookAndFeelNames[] list.

      • setLanguage

        public void setLanguage(int idiomIndex)
        This method sets the language for the GUIs.
        Parameters:
        idiomIndex - An int value obtained from Settings.LanguageValues[] list.

      • setEncryptionMethod

        public void setEncryptionMethod(int encryptionAlgorithm)
        This method sets the encryption method for getting files checksum.
        Parameters:
        encryptionAlgorithm - An int value obtained from Settings.CypherMethodList[] list.

      • setX

        public void setX(int xScreenPosition)
        This method sets the individual horizontal position of the dialog screen.
        Parameters:
        xScreenPosition - An int value that informs the horizontal position of the settings dialog.

      • setY

        public void setY(int yScreenPosition)
        This method sets the individual vertical position of the dialog screen.
        Parameters:
        yScreenPosition - An int value that informs the vertical position of the settings dialog.

      • getDirectory

        public java.lang.String getDirectory()
        This method returns the current working directory observed by the Monitor and Worker threads.
        Returns:
        Returns an String containing a path to the directory to be observed.

      • getLookAndFeel

        public int getLookAndFeel()
        This method returns the current look and feel of the system.
        Returns:
        Returns an int value that represents a 'Look and Feel' from "Settings.LookAndFeelNames[]"

      • getLanguage

        public java.lang.String getLanguage()
        This method returns the current language of the system.
        Returns:
        Returns a String value that represents a language from "Settings.LanguageValues[]"

      • getLanguageIndex

        public int getLanguageIndex()
        This method returns the current language index of the system.
        Returns:
        Returns an int value that represents a language from "Settings.LanguageValues[]"

      • getEncryptionMethod

        public int getEncryptionMethod()
        This method returns the current encryption method used by the system.
        Returns:
        Returns an int value that represents an encryption method from "Settings.CypherMethodList[]"

      • getX

        public int getX()
        This method returns the current horizontal position used for placing the settings dialog.
        Returns:
        Returns an int value of the last X axis settings screen position.

      • getY

        public int getY()
        This method returns the current vertical position used for placing the settings dialog.
        Returns:
        Returns an int value of the last Y axis settings screen position.

      • setChanged

        public void setChanged(boolean confirmation)
        This method sets if there is a changed settings or not on Settings Dialog.
        Parameters:
        confirmation - A boolean value that informs true if some value has been changed or false if any value has not been changed.

      • resetEncryptionChanged

        public void resetEncryptionChanged()
        This method sets the encryption method to be unchanged status.

      • isChanged

        public boolean isChanged()
        This method returns if some changes were detected on settings dialog.
        Returns:
        Returns true if settings were changed. Returns false if settings remain unchanged.

      • isDirectoryFirstTime

        public boolean isDirectoryFirstTime()
        This method informs whether user has already selected a directory to be monitored or not.
        Returns:
        Returns true if directory has never changed before. Returns false if directory has already being changed later.

      • isEncryptionChanged

        public boolean isEncryptionChanged()
        This method informs if the encryption method were changed from settings dialog screen.
        Returns:
        Returns true if encryption method is changed. Returns false if encryption method remains unchanged.
